programme.desc: A supply-train leader holds his own against his malevolent competition and contends with Comanche attacks, all the while searching for his father's killer.

programme.title: Duchess of Idaho
programme.desc: A carnival swimmer helps her best friend get with the friend's boss, and tries to land a bandleader for herself.

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra and his Rat Pack in a caper film about a war hero who calls together his old platoon for an unconventional reunion: rip off five Las Vegas casinos on New Year's Eve, split the cash and set themselves up for life. The film was remade in 2001 with George Clooney in the Sinatra role. (cc).

programme.title: MGM Parade Show
programme.desc: (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Downstairs
programme.desc: John Gilbert (who wrote the story) is excellent in this study of an amoral, blackmailing chauffeur employed by a baroness (Olga Baclanova). Anna: Virginia Bruce. Albert: Paul Lukas. Baron: Reginald Owen. Countess: Hedda Hopper. Interesting cast, good direction. Directed by Monta Bell.

programme.title: Loose Ankles
programme.desc: Romantic farce about a young heiress (Loretta Young) pursuing a boy (Douglas Fairbanks Jr.) her family finds acceptable. Katherine: Ethel Wales. Sarah: Louise Fazenda. Directed by Ted Wilde.

programme.title: She Had to Say Yes
programme.desc: A secretary in a garment factory is torn between her salesman-fiancée and a rakish businessman who is one of his biggest customers.

programme.title: Faithless
programme.desc: Soap opera about once-socially prominent lovers during the Depression. She's an heiress who loses her fortune, but marries a millionaire for money, and he's an executive who winds up working as a blue-collar laborer.

programme.title: Hell's Highway
programme.desc: Exposé of brutal prison conditions in the South. Richard Dix, Tom Brown, Rochelle Hudson, Louise Carter. Skinner: C. Henry Gordon. Whiteside: Stanley Fields. Billings: Oscar Apfel. Maxie: Sandy Roth. Jackson: Warner Richmond. Matthew: Charles Middleton. Fine cast. Directed by Rowland Brown.

programme.title: Safe in Hell
programme.desc: Well-acted yarn about a murderer (Dorothy Mackaill) hiding out with her lover (Donald Cook) in a tropical refuge. Van Saal: Ralf Harolde. Egan: John Wray. Bruno: Morgan Wallace. Gomez: Victor Varconi. Angie: Cecil Cunningham. Leonie: Nina Mae McKinney. Larsen: Gustav Von Seyffertitz. William A. Wellman directed.

programme.title: Jewel Robbery
programme.desc: Set against the baroque beauty of Vienna, a debonair thief unexpectedly falls in love with his latest target, the sophisticated wife of a baron.

programme.title: Three on a Match
programme.desc: The tangled destinies of three school pals.

programme.title: Footlight Parade
programme.desc: Busby Berkeley musical extravaganza, with James Cagney doubling as both a Broadway show producer and a song-and-dance man whose livelihood is threatened by the advent of talkies. Dorothy Lamour (her film debut) and Ann Sothern appear as chorus girls.

programme.title: Blonde Crazy
programme.desc: James Cagney and Joan Blondell are a wisecracking team in this cleverly written yarn about two hotel employees who form a confidence team. Barker: Louis Calhern. Helen: Noel Francis. Peggy: Polly Walters. Reynolds: Ray Milland. Johnson: Guy Kibbee. Hank: Nat Pendleton. Mrs. Snyder: Maude Eburne. Directed by Roy Del Ruth.

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: Best Picture-nominated hoedown is set in 1850s Oregon, where a group of brothers kidnap a passel of comely lasses with the intention of marriage, but when the men's farm gets snowed in and they're all trapped together, the ladies' hearts begin to melt. An Oscar winner for Best Musical Score.(n)

programme.title: It Happened at the World's Fair
programme.desc: Elvis Presley vehicle in which he plays a pilot who loses his plane due to gambling debts, so he and his partner head to the 1962 Seattle World's Fair to see if they can get work to earn money to reclaim their impounded aircraft.(n)

programme.title: The Silver Horde
programme.desc: A fisherman in Alaska feuds with the father of the woman he loves, leading to the dad's killing at the hands of the salmon hunter's partner.(n)

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: Best Picture winner is a portrait of life on a Honolulu Army post just before the attack on Pearl Harbor, and focuses on two rebellious privates and a tough but fair-minded sergeant who's swept into a torrid affair with his CO's wife. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Graduate
programme.desc: A recent college grad in the throes of a nihilistic, existential crisis, begins a tawdry, secret affair with a seductive older woman, but the relationship takes a turn when he realizes his true feelings lay elsewhere. Features an excellent soundtrack of Simon and Garfunkel songs and Oscar-winning direction by Mike Nichols.(n)

programme.title: Double Dynamite
programme.desc: A bank teller's gambling winnings match his bank's cash shortage.(n)

programme.title: High Society
programme.desc: Musical remake of "The Philadelphia Story" (1940) features a score by Cole Porter and stars Grace Kelly as an heiress whose wedding plans are complicated by a reporter (Frank Sinatra) and ex-husband (Bing Crosby). The musical score and the song "True Love" were Oscar nominated. (cc).(n)

programme.title: None But the Brave
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra took over the director's chair for the first (and only) time in this WWII drama, about Japanese and American soldiers stranded on a remote Pacific island. They agree to a truce to focus on bringing help to the island, but once either side's forces reach them, the fighting will pick up where it left off.(n)

programme.title: Robin and the 7 Hoods
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra (who produced) and his Rat Pack (in their final movie collaboration) star in this spoof of gangster films that's set in Roaring '20s Chicago and is a mixture of the Robin Hood fable and "Guys and Dolls." Eight songs by Sammy Cahn and Jimmy Van Heusen highlight the film, including the Oscar-nominated "My Kind of Town" (sung by Sinatra). (cc).(n)

programme.title: Anchors Aweigh
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is about two sailors, one innocent and inexperienced and the other dashing and cavalier, who go on leave in Hollywood, looking for fun and quite possibly falling in love. One of the musical's highlights is Gene Kelly's dance duet with an animated Jerry the Mouse of "Tom and Jerry" cartoon fame. Features an Oscar-winning score. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Five Oscars, including Best Picture, went to this epic drama about a Roman general who winds up an enslaved gladiator when he refuses to pledge loyalty to the emperor's power-hungry son. The resourceful former general promptly escapes, only to resurface later as an enslaved gladiator with revenge on his mind. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Marlon (Marlon Wayans) is on the receiving end of a number of practical jokes after a visit from Shawn's old high-school buddy Terrell (Casey Lee). Pops: John Witherspoon. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. (repeat).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Shawn and Marlon think Pops (John Witherspoon) has just a few weeks to live. Gloria Gaynor sings "I Will Survive" in a cameo appearance. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Dr. Tuttle: Barry Wiggins. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Conclusion: Michael throws Jr. out of the house after he and Jay find their son in their bed with his girlfriend (Meagan Good). Jay disagrees---strenuously---about the punishment, and the Kyle household is not a happy one. As for Jr., he has been banished to a tent in the backyard. Franklin: Noah Gray-Cabey. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael and Jay are both called for jury duty and wind up on the same case. It's “open and shut,” Michael declares. Jay demurs, not surprisingly. And she suspects Michael's motives because she knows he wants to get home to watch a “Godfather” marathon on TV. Thug: Steve Schirripa. Blue-Collar Guy: Brent Sexton. Judge: Thom Gossom Jr. Prosecutor: Maggie Rowe. R.J.: DeRay Davis. Todd: Allen Todd Lynn. Brian: Brian Holtzman. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire and Jr. have been fighting all their lives, but when both claim to have found a wallet with $500 (and no I.D.) in it, it's time for “family court,” the honorable (“and very handsome”) Judge Michael Kyle presiding. Jay agrees to serve as Claire's lawyer while Kady's genius boyfriend Franklin (Noah Gray-Cabey) argues for Jr. Meanwhile, Claire decides to become a vegetarian, prompted by her boyfriend, Tony (Andrew McFarlane), who has begun to fast. And Michael volunteers to teach Kady to ride a bicycle. Vanessa: Meagan Good. (repeat).

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Hollywood
programme.desc: A1 confronts Lyrica about Kimberly's allegations. A raging family feud threatens Ray J. and Princess' gender reveal party. Marcus blindsides Brooke with an unwelcoming surprise. Kimberly comes face-to-face with a ghost from her past. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: OG and her man discover they're not seeing eye to eye on marriage. Malaysia tries to keep her family from tearing itself apart. An explosive rumor threatens to destroy a friendship within the group. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Shaunie launches an investigation into a rumor that could blow up the group, and it results in more questions than answers. Jen continues to cover up her part. Meanwhile, Malaysia is pleasantly surprised when Cece and Byron set her up on a blind date with their handsome friend. At a meeting of the Wives, Tami lashes out and says something she can't take back. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Tami lashes out at Evelyn, leaving the entire group taking cover and taking sides. As an escape, Evelyn puts together a charity event, but Shaunie refuses to welcome Jen. Malaysia tries to get CeCe and Kristen past their conflict. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Jackie stars in a play, but her nerves threaten to get the best of her. OG deals with the death of her brother, the loss ultimately brings her and an enemy close. The Wives come out to support Jackie's play, but there's just as much drama off-stage. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Evelyn's trip to Puerto Rico becomes a more emotional experience than she bargained for. Jen enlists professional help to solve her love life issues. Malaysia has a difficult talk with her son. Jackie helps Reggie plan next step. (repeat).

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: A social satire in which two inept black FBI agents pose as spoiled white socialites to uncover a kidnapping plot.

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Hollywood
programme.desc: In the Season 4 finale, Safaree says goodbye to Hollywood and makes one last play for Nikki Baby; Teairra returns from rehab with a new perspective; a confrontation rocks Fizz's B2K reunion; Brooke and Bridget transform the showcase; and Hazel comes for Ray J. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Hollywood
programme.desc: K. Michelle returns to Hollywood, and she already has a score to settle with Lyrica. Moniece's bad behavior catches up to her. Scandal threatens Ray J's marriage to Princess. Teairra hits the town for the first time since rehab. (repeat).(n)

programme.desc: Phor gets a second chance to pursue his dream. A family crisis brings Don and Ashley back together. Lily and Charmaine's fight reaches a fiery end. A male stripper bares all during the Loyal Ink Grand Opening. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Hip Hop Squares
programme.desc: Sky competes against Kid Ink. Also: Monica; T.I.; Wale; Jasmine "Golden Barbie" Sanders; Selita Ebanks; Rotimi; Deon Cole; Tiffany Haddish; Lil Duval. (repeat).(n)

programme.desc: Cora lands a full-time job as a high-school teacher, but she faces an A-grade test when a student arrives inebriated. Meanwhile, the Colonel seeks employment after discovering his nest egg has emptied. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Brown scores a honey, but she might be after his money. Elsewhere, Brianna gets busted for shoplifting. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Boy troubles plague Brianna when her young beau falls for Sasha. Meanwhile, Edna's theater date falls ill, so she goes out with his son instead. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin and Gina (Martin Lawrence, Tisha Campbell) make a bet to abstain from sex for two weeks. Pam: Tichina Arnold. Tommy: Thomas Mikal Ford. Cole: Carl Anthony Payne II. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin and Gina get stuck in a bus station on Christmas Eve en route to Gina's parents. Station Manager: Christopher Darga. Santa: Ernie Lee Banks. Gerri: Jeri Gray. Gina: Tisha Campbell. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin has his day in court when he decides to fight a traffic ticket. Off. Williams: O'Neal Compton. Judge Wheatley: Francesca Roberts. Bailiff: Ellis Williams. Juror No. 1: Ellaraino. Gina: Tisha Campbell. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: When Martin's CD player is missing, Stan convinces him that one of his friends stole it. Stan: Garrett Morris. Brother Man: Reginald Ballard. Tommy: Thomas Mikal Ford. Cole: Carl Anthony Payne II. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.sub-title: I Was En Vogue's Love Slave
programme.desc: A tabloid prints a story about Marlon being the "love slave" of the En Vogue singers (Cindy Herron Braggs, Maxine Jones and Terry Ellis). En Vogue performs "Let It Flow" in a cameo appearance. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. Pops: John Witherspoon. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: The family is placed under police protection after Marlon (Marlon Wayans) witnesses a bank robbery. Frank/Jesse: Norris Young. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. Pops: John Witherspoon. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Det. Fine: Yareli Arizmendi. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Shawn's former boss, Ted (Jack Plotnick), is released from a mental institution and plots revenge against Shawn for causing him to lose his job at an ad agency. Marlon: Marlon Wayans. Pops: John Witherspoon. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Mr. Keeler: Robert Starr. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Pops (John Witherspoon), Shawn and Marlon compete on the quiz show "Family Battle." Dick Ferndale: Fred Willard. Mr. Webster: Patrick O'Brien. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Franklin's little sister, Aretha (Jamia Simone Nash), is a terrific singer, but he doesn't exactly brag about her. Meanwhile, Jay finds a photo of Michael's former girlfriend among his memorabilia. Why, she wonders, has he saved it? Actually, “wonders” doesn't adequately describe her reaction. “We have a crisis in our marriage,” she fumes. Franklin: Noah Gray-Cabey. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire and Tony (Andrew McFarlane) announce that they are going to have sex to Michael and Jay, who react as expected. But after calming down they strategize on how to stop the impending tryst. “We'll scare the pants off them,” Michael tells Jay, “Well, not the pants.” Meanwhile, Jr. gets Kady to think that she made him sick, so she's at his beck and call. But Franklin (Noah Gray-Cabey) smells a rat. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire has been asked to the senior prom, but Michael won't let her go. Their compromise: Michael and Jay will chaperone. Suffice it to say that Jay thinks more of the plan than Claire does (or than Michael does, at first). Meanwhile, Jr's rehabbing an old car and he wants Michael to pay for it. Michael agrees, but that isn't necessarily good news for Jr. Donovan: Roshawn Franklin. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Polska noc
programme.desc: Dla tych, którzy twierdzą, że w telewizjach muzycznych i radiach pojawia się za mało polskiej muzyki, Eska TV proponuje program "Polska noc". To całonocne pasmo zarezerwowane jest dla krajowych wykonawców.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia

programme.title: Dzień dobry
programme.desc: Poranne pasmo muzyczne, w którym prezentowane są najlepsze teledyski artystów cieszących się dużą popularnością.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia

programme.title: Dzień dobry
programme.desc: Poranne pasmo muzyczne, w którym prezentowane są najlepsze teledyski artystów cieszących się dużą popularnością.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Co się słucha?
programme.desc: Prowadzący sprawdzają, czego słuchają przypadkowo spotkani na ulicy ludzie.

programme.title: 10 hitów 1 po 2
programme.desc: Twórcy programu w każdym wydaniu prezentują 10 wybranych hitów. Utwory, będące największymi przebojami najsłynniejszych wykonawców, grane są jeden po drugim.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: The Worst Witch
programme.desc: Mildred's having fun jumping high into the air with Enid - using pirated magic to make the grass bouncy. Maud's getting fed up with Enid constantly distracting Mildred - Maud knows Mildred needs to knuckle down if she's going to stand a chance at the academy and can't bear the thought of losing her. Mildred receives a singing teddy from home and it makes her feel homesick. When Mildred looks to Maud for help in Miss Gullet's transformations class, Maud doesn't bail her out and Mildred turns Ethel into a pig instead of a mouse into frog. She doesn't even manage to turn Ethel back successfully - she still has a pig's snout! Mildred receives a harsh warning from Miss Hardbroom who threatens expulsion if she can't perform the spell correctly. Mildred feels fed up with all the rules of school and always being the worst witch. It's the final straw, she wants to go home. Drusilla intercepts her leaving, telling her that Maud and Enid are fighting. But it's a trick, and Mildred finds herself facing Ethel. As revenge for still having a pig snout, Ethel turns Mildred into a frog and throws her out of the window.(n)

programme.title: The Worst Witch
programme.desc: Everyone's surprised to hear the Great Wizard is making an unexpected visit to Cackle's Academy. He's had a tip off that the school is going rapidly downhill and it looks like non-magical Mildred is at the heart of the problems. Miss Cackle (really Agatha) refuses to expel Mildred and waxes lyrical about her. The Great Wizard insists that Mildred should perform a magical display to prove herself. Creative Mildred conducts a magical potions choir, but it ends in disaster leaving Miss Cackle on thin ice. To everyone's surprise, Miss Cackle (Agatha) makes Mildred lead a broomstick display. Mildred works out that Agatha is impersonating Miss Cackle but has to go ahead with the display - not realising Ethel had put a spell on the broomstick. Mildred begs Maud to find the real Miss Cackle, so while Mildred and Enid are in peril in the air, Maud battles her way up to Miss Cackle's room to find her under an entrancement spell. Just as Mildred and Enid start to plummet, the real Miss Cackle saves them. The Great Wizard has to eat his words - Mildred is a good witch and deserves her place in the school.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Marrying Mum and Dad Awards
programme.desc: Welcome to the first ever Marrying Mum and Dad awards ceremony - the 'I do's'. The families from series 4 celebrate their best moments. But who will be crowned 'Most Terrific Transport' or 'Most Outrageous Outfit'? Time to relive all the amazing highs from last series weddings.(n)

programme.title: 4 O'Clock Club
programme.desc: Dexter takes the 4 O'Clock regulars on a half-term camping trip, but a mix-up leads them to turn back and head home.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Ate My Homework
programme.desc: Team captains Poppy and Ben compete compete in the children's comedy panel show, featuring studio-based frolics and slapstick challenges. Host Iain Stirling is joined by special guests Stu Goldsmith, Suzi Ruffell, Ivo Graham and Katie Thistleton.(n)

programme.title: Just Kidding
programme.desc: Children's comedy show that lets them concoct pranks to play on unsuspecting adults.(n)

programme.title: Absolute Genius with Dick & Dom
programme.sub-title: Absolute Genius: Monster Builds: Under Attack

programme.title: Jamie Johnson
programme.desc: When Harry and Dillon discover that it was Mike who ended Hansard's career with a horror tackle, they do everything they can to wind Jamie up during the cup match. programme.title: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: Juan Castanetta takes another unusual approach to teaching Spanish, Mr Capp tries to be cool but proves he's anything but and Mrs Winstone has an unusual proposition for Jasmine.(n)

programme.title: Newsround

programme.title: Hank Zipzer

programme.title: Deadly Dinosaurs with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: In this episode of Deadly Dinosaurs, Steve goes undercover! He is on a mission to unearth the sneakiest dinosaurs that were far deadlier than they first appeared! We're learning new things about even the most notorious dinosaurs and first up Steve meets Sinornithosaurus - a dinosaur hiding a deadly dental secret. He then races a Velociraptor in a climbing challenge with a surprising result. Finally Steve puts Argentinasaurus to the ultimate test to see how earth shattering its stamp really was.(n)

programme.title: Diddy TV

programme.title: Odd Squad
